lead_paragraph: The ensemble played a vivid programmatic work by Carlo Monza, part of a concert tracing the development of the symphonic genre in Italy and its impact on a young visitor, Mozart.

headline.print_headline: Buoyant Spirit, Nuanced Shadings and a Dynamic Palette
headline.main: Review: Europa Galante Plays at Alice Tully Hall

snippet: The ensemble played a vivid programmatic work by Carlo Monza, part of a concert tracing the development of the symphonic genre in Italy and its impact on a young visitor, Mozart.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews concert of Italian symphonic works by composers Monza, Sammartini and Mozart, performed by period-instrument ensemble Europa Galante at Alice Tully Hall.
